title: Chair of Time's Up UK: 'Two years is no time for #MeToo to have changed things'
text:
"Michael Caine is a man of a certain generation," explains Dame Heather Rabbatts. "And when talking about #MeToo he said no young woman actor would abused again".

Dame Rabbatts, the chair of Time's Up UK, continues: ’If people like him are saying that, it’s a sign that it’s entered the zeitgeist of the industry.’

Caine made his comments this summer. But it is now two years to the week since the first slew of sexual misconduct allegations were made against movie mogul Harvey Weinstein.

Back in October 2017, spurred on by the bravery of Weinstein’s alleged victims (he denies all claims of non-consensual sex) women across the world began to share, on social media, their own #MeToo stories. Within...
description: "Michael Caine is a man of a certain generation," explains Dame Heather Rabbatts.
